books.author: Ernest Cline
books.description: In a sequel to “Ready Player One,” Wade Watts discovers a technological advancement and goes on a new quest.
books.title: READY PLAYER TWO

books.author: John Grisham
books.description: The third book in the Jake Brigance series. A 16-year-old is accused of killing a deputy in Clanton, Miss., in 1990.
books.title: A TIME FOR MERCY

books.author: James Patterson
books.description: The 28th book in the Alex Cross series. An investigation of a double homicide sends Alex Cross to Alabama.
books.title: DEADLY CROSS

books.author: Brit Bennett
books.description: The lives of twin sisters who run away from a Southern Black community at age 16 diverge as one returns and the other takes on a different racial identity but their fates intertwine.
books.title: THE VANISHING HALF

books.author: Nicholas Sparks
books.description: A doctor serving in the Navy in Afghanistan goes back to North Carolina where two women change his life.
books.title: THE RETURN

books.author: David Baldacci
books.description: The F.B.I. agent Atlee Pine’s search for her twin sister overlaps with a military investigator’s hunt for someone involved in a global conspiracy.
books.title: DAYLIGHT

books.author: Michael Connelly
books.description: The sixth book in the Mickey Haller series. Haller defends himself when police find the body of a former client in his car’s trunk.
books.title: THE LAW OF INNOCENCE

books.author: Lee Child and Andrew Child
books.contributor: by Lee Child and Andrew Child
books.description: Jack Reacher intervenes on an ambush in Tennessee and uncovers a conspiracy.
books.title: THE SENTINEL

books.author: Nora Roberts
books.description: The first book in the Dragon Heart Legacy series. Breen Kelly travels through a portal in Ireland to a land of faeries and mermaids.

books.description: Poems and illustrations by the author of “Milk and Honey” and “The Sun and Her Flowers.”

books.description: In a quiet town on the North Carolina coast in 1969, a young woman who survived alone in the marsh becomes a murder suspect.

books.author: Janet Evanovich
books.description: The 27th book in the Stephanie Plum series. Stephanie deals with a soldier of fortune from Little Havana.
books.title: FORTUNE AND GLORY

books.author: Matt Haig
books.description: Nora Seed finds a library beyond the edge of the universe that contains books with multiple possibilities of the lives one could have lived.
books.title: THE MIDNIGHT LIBRARY

books.author: Fredrik Backman
books.description: A failed bank robber holds a group of strangers hostage at an apartment open house.
books.title: ANXIOUS PEOPLE

books.author: Brandon Sanderson
books.description: The fourth book in the Stormlight Archive series. Technological discoveries and an ensuing arms race change how a war is fought.
books.title: RHYTHM OF WAR

books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years.

books.description: A missing scientist, strange noises under the Arctic ice and a mole who infiltrated American intelligence bedevil President Jack Ryan. Read by Scott Brick. 13 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: TOM CLANCY: SHADOW OF THE DRAGON

books.author: Nicholas Sparks
books.description: A doctor serving in the Navy in Afghanistan goes back to North Carolina where two women change his life. Read by Kyf Brewer. 9 hours, 56 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE RETURN

books.author: Barack Obama
books.description: In the first volume of his presidential memoirs, Barack Obama offers personal reflections on his formative years and pivotal moments through his first term. Read by the author. 29 hours, 10 minutes unabridged.
books.title: A PROMISED LAND

books.author: Matthew McConaughey
books.description: The Academy Award-winning actor shares snippets from the diaries he kept over the last 35 years. Read by the author. 6 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: GREENLIGHTS

books.author: David Sedaris
books.description: A collection of the humorist’s essays including “Me Talk Pretty One Day” and “A Guy Walks Into a Bar Car.” Read by the author. 13 hours, 8 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE BEST OF ME

books.author: Isabel Wilkerson
books.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist reveals a rigid hierarchy in America today. Read by Robin Miles. 14 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: CASTE

books.author: Sam Heughan and Graham McTavish
books.contributor: by Sam Heughan and Graham McTavish
books.description: The stars of “Outlander” use various means of travel to explore Scotland. Read by the authors. 10 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: CLANLANDS

books.author: Michelle Obama
books.description: The former first lady describes how she balanced work, family and her husband’s political ascent. Read by the author. 19 hours, 3 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BECOMING

books.author: Glennon Doyle
books.description: The activist and public speaker describes her journey of listening to her inner voice. Read by the author. 8 hours, 22 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNTAMED

books.author: Michael J Fox
books.description: The actor discusses the challenges he has faced with Parkinson’s disease and other setbacks that caused him to reassess his outlook. Read by the author. 5 hours, 59 minutes unabridged.
books.title: NO TIME LIKE THE FUTURE

books.author: Dolly Parton with Robert K Oermann
books.contributor: by Dolly Parton with Robert K. Oermann
books.description: The country music icon offers insights on 175 of her songs. Read by Dolly Parton. 5 hours, 18 minutes unabridged.
books.title: DOLLY PARTON, SONGTELLER

books.author: Candace Owens
books.description: The conservative commentator makes her case that Black Americans should part ways with the Democratic Party. Read by the author. 6 hours, 51 minutes unabridged.
books.title: BLACKOUT

books.author: Alex Trebek
books.description: A memoir by the host of the TV game show “Jeopardy!,” from 1984 to 2020. Read by Ken Jennings and the author. 4 hours, 34 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE ANSWER IS ...

books.author: Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.contributor: by Jocko Willink and Leif Babin
books.description: Applying the principles of Navy SEALs leadership training to any organization. Read by the authors. 8 hours, 15 minutes unabridged.
books.title: EXTREME OWNERSHIP

books.author: Kamala Harris
books.description: A memoir by the daughter of immigrants who is now the vice president-elect. Read by the author. 9 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: THE TRUTHS WE HOLD

books.author: Malcolm Gladwell
books.description: Famous examples of miscommunication serve as the backdrop to explain potential conflicts. Read by the author. 8 hours, 42 minutes unabridged.
books.title: TALKING TO STRANGERS

books.author: Emmanuel Acho
books.description: A look at some questions and concepts needed to address systemic racism. Read by the author. 4 hours, 26 minutes unabridged.
books.title: UNCOMFORTABLE CONVERSATIONS WITH A BLACK MAN

books.author: Fareed Zakaria
books.title: TEN LESSONS FOR A POST-PANDEMIC WORLD

books.description: Raina finds her tummy trouble might be more than it first appears to be when she goes back to school.
books.title: GUTS

books.description: Jordan Banks, an artistically inclined seventh grader from Washington Heights, has a tough time navigating an upscale private school where diversity is low and maintaining his neighborhood friendships.

books.description: Will Izuku Midoriya's chance encounter with a superhero change his fate? Most likely!

books.description: Drew Ellis finds he must work 10 times as hard as his privileged classmates at the Riverdale Academy Day School.

books.description: President Jack Ryan learns of a plot against America when he tries to help an old friend who has been arrested in Indonesia.
